column4: I'm sorry to ask again, but I think it might have gotten missed. I want to set up an FTP server on my Ubuntu install, how do I do that?
but troy_s is right, better to use ssh. :)
well, since it's your server, you can jsut tell the people to use sftp instead of ftp :)
but anyway, if you really want ftp, just use any one of the ftp daemons. check out the list:
i don't have an ftp server set up myself (ssh is good for me :) ), but i've heard that pure-ftpd is pretty decent. don't know if it has a gui though...
gftp is just an ftp CLIENT, not server
yes, it can be used for file transfer just as regular ftp. you just need to have an sftp-capable client.
at least not if it's a USB1 drive :)
heh, that explains it
heh, that's some pretty heavy double duty there.
are you running the synaptic package manager?
did you enable the multiverse and universe repos?
from menu, select settings>repositories (or something similar), and then check the universe and multiverse checkboxes
or as an alternative, you can edit /etc/apt/sources.list file directly. (btw, just for the record, you running dapper or breezy?)
ok. i'm doing breezy, so the exact menu options may be different for you.
but anyway, so have you found the universe and multiverse checkboxes?
cool :) hey, we all go through it at first. slowly the cluelessness dissolves away. somewhat. :)
lamp is the std abbrev for "linux, apache, mysql, php" since its such a frequent server config
ah. well, there should be some howto tutorials on the ubuntuforums, search for lamp.
use command "id" to find out your uid and your gid and etc
gid = group id :)
